name: Flowerbomb Tiger Lily Eau de Parfum
about: Fragrance Family:Fresh.Scent Type:Fresh Solar.Key Notes:Coconut Milk, Tiger Lily, Mango.Fragrance Description:A warm-solar perfume for women that transports you to a tropical summer oasis. The fragrance opens with an inviting burst of refreshing coconut milk, deepens into a wild-floral tiger lily heart, and fuses with a juicy mango-fruit base for a sensual, tropical scent..About the Bottle:The instantly recognizable grenade fragrance bottle displays the amber hue of the floral women's perfume within, contrasting the harsh shape with a distinctly feminine scent..About the Fragrance:The perfect perfume for the wild and fierce woman who roars in all her glory, fully embracing her sensual femininity. Unleash the power of the wild tiger lily, a symbol of confidence, to let your sensuality roar.
ingredients: Alcohol, Parfum/Fragrance, Aqua/Water/Eau, Benzyl Salicylate, Benzyl Alcohol, Linalool, Hydroxycitronellal, Limonene, Ethylhexyl Salicylate, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Coumarin, Citronellol, Methyl Anthranilate, Citral, Benzyl Benzoate, Geraniol, Ci 19140/Yellow 5.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Fragrance is intensified by the warmth of your own body. Apply in the creases of your knees and elbows for a longer-lasting, stronger scent. .-After applying, avoid rubbing or dabbing skin. This breaks down the fragrance, causing it to wear off more quickly. .-If you prefer placing fragrance on your wrists, be sure to reapply after frequent handwashing, as this tends to rinse off the scent. .-Replace fragrance after 12 months. Expired perfumes more than a year old lose the integrity of the original scent... Eau de Toilette or Eau de Parfum?: .The difference lies in the volume of perfume oil. While EDT contains five to nine percent, EDP contains more, usually eight to 14 percent. EDPs, therefore, last longer and smell more intense.

Maybe even longer!   Fragrance Notes - üëáüèª  Floral - Tiger Lily üå∫ Ambery Fruity - Mango ü•≠ Coconut Milk Accordü•• Benzoin - Which I had to Google. I found out it is a resinous tree üå¥ in the Styracaceae family. The Benzoin resin is harvested & used in middle notes of perfumes, cosmetics and incense. It has warm vanilla & balsamic notes with spicy/cinnamon undertones. Farmers climb up to the top of these trees using rope laders & make a careful incision that causes it to weep for harvest. A technique that is predicted to soon become a lost art due to synthetic chemicals being used as a replacement for Benzoin. So fascinating! This perfume is a must-have! Plus the bottle is beautiful as well!

reviews.review_text: I loved this scent! I am very familiar with Viktor&Rolf scented perfum sprays, and I wasn‚Äôt very keen on the original Flower Bomb, but did like others such as Flowerbomb Dew and Good Fortune. This one, compared to those, is more bold and daring. Where as I would typically use the other scents for light occasions or targeted weather, I use this one daily, whether it‚Äôs for an occasion or a lack of. The scent starts off with the sweet and delicious Coconut Milk scent that (for a top layer) lasts surprisingly long. It then opens to the bold Tiger Lilly scent, which is beautiful mixed with the lingering coconut milk. Again, this middle note lasts a very long time and eventually takes over the coconut milk smell. Once the Coconut milk scent has vanished, out comes the fruity goodness of the Mango. It‚Äôs truly amazing how it goes from being coconut milk and Tiger Lilly to Tiger Lilly and Mango, but it does, and leaves an amazing impression. These two scents together make a powerful lasting scent that just makes you want to continuously smell any and every thing. I‚Äôve had so many compliments while wearing this, it‚Äôs unreal. This Parfum spray keeps you on your toes and leaves a lasting impression of bold elegance that just cannot be beaten! I highly recommend this for all occasions!

reviews.review_text: Let me start by saying, it‚Äôs an absolute gem in the world of fragrances. Wearing it for an outing, its lingering scent followed me all day, enveloping me in a delightful aura even after I returned home.  The fragrance of Flowerbomb Tiger Lily Eau de Parfum is like a refreshing breeze from a tropical paradise. Its opening notes of coconut milk accord instantly transport you to sun-kissed shores. As the scent evolves, the exotic tiger lily accord takes center stage, infusing the perfume with a wild and captivating essence. The juicy mango accord adds a layer of tropical sensuality, perfectly balanced by the warm and comforting benzoin base.  The bottle itself is a work of art ‚Äì luxurious, stylish, and an eye-catching addition to my perfume tray. Its design reflects the essence of the fragrance within, capturing the essence of a summer oasis in every detail.  In essence, Flowerbomb Tiger Lily Eau de Parfum is not just a perfume; it‚Äôs an experience. It‚Äôs a compliment catcher, a mood lifter, and a reminder of sunny days and carefree moments. It‚Äôs the perfect companion for those who seek to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature, wherever they may be.

The fragrance has a fairly average sillage and decent longevity, with scents that evolve at different points.  While the Tiger Lilly Flowerbomb deviates from the traditional Flowerbomb DNA, if you enjoy summertime warm scents, this perfume might be a great fit for you, offering a unique and captivating scent experience.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As someone who‚Äôs always on the hunt for stunning perfumes and is somewhat of a connoisseur for specific scents, you can imagine my excitement when Influenster and Viktor & Rolf sent me this to try in exchange for an honest review.  As someone who has a particular nose for mainly aromatic and amber-based perfumes (because they are my favorites), I first checked the notes on this to see whether I‚Äôd like it or not. For reference, my favorite perfumes are from Jo Malone line (Wood Sage & Sea Salt), Guerlain (Mon Guerlain), and Clean Fragrance (Nude Santal & Heliotrope which has unfortunately been discontinued).   This perfume has top notes of coconut milk, bergamot, followed by Tiger Lily, Jasmine, Freesia as middle notes, and followed with base notes of mango and benzoin. Immediately, I thought this would be floral heavy (something I actually am not a huge fan of tbh) so I was a little indifferent to this, not going to lie.   Upon receiving it, I sprayed about 3-4 sprays on my wrist to test this. I first definitely smelled coconut and bergamot, two fragrance notes I actually like. About 15 minutes in, I smelled the mango and benzoin.   Personally, I‚Äôm not a huge fan of benzoin as it can translate weirdly depending on your skin. This however, smelled gorgeous on my skin. I did find it a bit overpowering though, which is why this isn‚Äôt exactly my favorite. Overpowering scented perfumes sometimes trigger a headache for me, and this one, unfortunately did that a little for me.   I tested this for a day, and after 8 hours of wear, the smell was still lingering. I would say I love the smell at 3-4 hours post spray as it‚Äôs not as overpowering as initial spray. I will say this is a VERY nice spring to summer perfume. I will be wearing this when special occasions call for it.

reviews.review_text: When I smell this, off the jump, I feel like it is a mix of Miami Glow by JLo (iykyk) and Tom Ford's Soleil Blanc- both summer faves of mines. But as it settles, it has a creaminess to it.... akin to what I pick up in Ariana Grande's Cloud fragrance. This creaminess is where the fragrance loses me- I'm not a huge fan- it's why I don't like Cloud. This fragrance lasts most of the day, like the other Viktor and Rolf perfumes, but as I mentioned, it does evolve into that creamier scent. The bottle and color of the glass are stunning and look beautiful on display.   This isn't a pass for me just yet. I don't hate it, and I do think that there are a ton of people who will LOVE it.  Sometimes, fragrance takes a minute to grow on me and something I thought I didn't like becomes a favorite.... with how I feel right now, I wouldn't be surprised if that happened.   If you like warm, summery scents but also enjoy the creaminess that Cloud has, I think this will be right up your alley for the warmer months....

It‚Äôs long lasting and well made (in my opinion the best made from the flowerbomb). It can be a great gift for person of any age. This scent can suit a person on their 20s as well as those in their 40s or older. Again it is a scent that I wouldn‚Äôt use during the winter but perfect for warm weather.
